result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelia L. Stewart

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety.  vp
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($100) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart not in court. Alyssa M. Schaller on behalf of Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. Defendant advised of financial changes. Court advised to defendant to go to public defender office again for evaluation.  Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court pro se.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.  Case calendared for status conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM051316  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/28/16. er

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin via-telephone.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record, the Court cancels previously issued bench warrant. Defense counsel informed the Court he will no longer be counsel on record.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Defendant taken into custody.  Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William R. Steinmetz in court requesting return on warrant for defendant in custody in Minnesota. Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on September 28, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. Assistant District Attorney Michael Lonksi notified.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney William R. Steinmetz in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear for today's scheduled plea and sentencing hearing.
Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance.
State requests bench warrant be issued.
  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms

Telephone call received from defense counsel informing he is unable to appear in court on March 17, he has contacted Asst. District Atty. M. Lonski as to rescheduling and informs State has no objection to rescheduling.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28 on April 15, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.
Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered STAYED bench warrant withdrawn.  Warrant was NOT forwarded to the Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with Attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements to the court regarding missed court appearance.
Court will withdraw stayed bench warrant.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Calendar call scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William R. Steinmetz in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance and informs Court that defendant is now working in the State of Minnesota.
Defense counsel requests stayed bench warrant.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 02-10-2016.
Court orders case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with Attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for pre-trial conference.
Case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties request a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Daniel B., and Equipment Lease Corp.

Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in court with attorney William R. Steinmetz.  Defendant Shelia L. Stewart in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT HAS PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
